channel.title: Various game crashes occurs on Dual-Screen Fullscreen setup (Not in windowed!)
channel.description:
Object: - Various game crashes occurs on Dual-Screen Fullscreen setup (Not in windowed!)
- Crash report #1 Crashing on map load, after defeating the tentacles, going down the ladder to reach the changelevel. After loading, the image is frozen, a small sound buffer can be heard, followed by silence, then the same sound buffer can be reheard, then the window closes and hl2.exe has stopped working.
- Crash report #2 In some maps, the flashlight is banned otherwise the game crashes (. Office complex opening map is the most notable one + some others I don't remember about.
Hardware: - Windows 7 32bit, Radeon X1950 XTX - Dual screen multi monitor setup: Primary 1280x1024 on the right 75hz, Secondary 1024x768 on the left 75hz, 100 pixels off the top. - Using only Primary as the game monitor.
Normal gameplay performance: - Excellent, no noticeable performance loss. - The fan runs louder than many other Source games, meaning somehow the game is extremely GPU intensive.
Artifacts: - None really
Conclusion: [b]- Game will crash on Dual-Screen Fullscreen setup.[/b]
How to fix: Either disable Dual-screen in the Windows settings, or, play in Windowed mode, or Noborder Windowed mode: - To play in Noborder mode: - Open Steam > Library. - On tle left, right click on Black Mesa > Properties - Click on button Set Launch Options - Type this into the field: -windowed -noborder -w 1280 -h 720 - Replace 1280 with the window width, and 720 with the window height.
Video settings considered as maximum: - Model detail: High - Texture detail: High - Shader detail: High - Water detail: Reflect all - Shadow detail: High - Color C.: Enabled - AA: 4x MSAA - Filtering mode: Anisotropix 8X - Wait for vertical sync: Disabled - Motion Blur: Enabled - Multicore Rendering: Unselectable (empty box) - HDR: Full
Tests performed in order:
#1: Load a save game near the ladder, then climb down #2: Start new game at Office Complex
- T1: (dxlevel 90) High quality settings (Video + BMS), Fullscreen, 1280x1024 #1 Crashes on map load #2 Crash on flashlight on
- T2: (dxlevel 81) Out of the box, Fullscreen, 1280x900 #1 NO crash, lots of texture errors and overlays errors #2 NO crash, lots of texture errors and overlays errors
- T3: (dxlevel 90) High quality settings, Windowed, 1024x768 #1 NO crash #2 NO crash
- T4: (dxlevel 90) High quality settings, Windowed Noborder, 1280x1024 #1 NO crash #2 NO crash
- T5: (dxlevel 90) High quality settings, Windowed, 1280x1024 #1 NO crash #2 NO crash
- T6: (dxlevel 90) High quality settings, Fullscreen, 1280x1024, [b]Dual-Screen setup disabled[/b] #1 NO crash #2 NO crash
- T7: Re-doing test T1 to ensure reproductibility. (Dual-Screen setup is re-enabled) #: Reproductible.
- T8: (dxlevel 90) High quality settings, Fullscreen, 1280x1024, Dual-Screen setup enabled, but second monitor is now on the right instead of the left #1 Crashes on map load #2 Crash on flashlight on
- T9: Re-doing test T6 to ensure reproductibility. #: Reproductible.
[b]I am ready to provide mini dumps on the crashing test.[/b]

  • Crash report #1
    Crashing on map load, after defeating the tentacles, going down the ladder to reach the changelevel.
    After loading, the image is frozen, a small sound buffer can be heard, followed by silence, then the same sound buffer can be reheard, then the window closes and hl2.exe has stopped working.

Hardware:

  • Windows 7 32bit, Radeon X1950 XTX
  • Dual screen multi monitor setup: Primary 1280x1024 on the right 75hz, Secondary 1024x768 on the left 75hz, 100 pixels off the top.

Normal gameplay performance:

  • Excellent, no noticeable performance loss.
  • The fan runs louder than many other Source games, meaning somehow the game is extremely GPU intensive.

Artifacts:

  • None really

Conclusion:
- Game will crash on Dual-Screen Fullscreen setup.

How to fix:
Either disable Dual-screen in the Windows settings, or, play in Windowed mode, or Noborder Windowed mode:

  • To play in Noborder mode:
  • Open Steam > Library.
  • On tle left, right click on Black Mesa > Properties
  • Click on button Set Launch Options
  • Type this into the field: -windowed -noborder -w 1280 -h 720
  • Replace 1280 with the window width, and 720 with the window height.

Video settings considered as maximum:

  • Model detail: High
  • Texture detail: High
  • Shader detail: High
  • Water detail: Reflect all
  • Shadow detail: High
  • Color C.: Enabled
  • AA: 4x MSAA
  • Filtering mode: Anisotropix 8X
  • Wait for vertical sync: Disabled
  • Motion Blur: Enabled
  • Multicore Rendering: Unselectable (empty box)
  • HDR: Full

#1: Load a save game near the ladder, then climb down
#2: Start new game at Office Complex
